critique: The executive order aims to convey a sense of neutrality, caution, and hope. It seeks to avoid causing irritation or offense to the combatants and emphasizes the importance of maintaining friendly relations with all nations. The primary emotions the president wants to convey are sadness (deploring the war), fear (of escalating tensions), and surprise (at the outbreak of war). The order also subtly aims to instill a sense of joy by promoting peace and friendship.
